body_content.explanation: relating to or accepting the theories of Charles Darwin, which described how animals and plants change and develop over millions of years, with those that are best suited to their environment being the most successful and others that are less well suited not continuing to exist:
examples: Religious fundamentalists tried to remove Darwinist elements of the curriculum.
The Darwinist philosopher puts religion on the same level as fairy tales.

body_content.explanation: someone who accepts the theories of Charles Darwin, which described how animals and plants change and develop over millions of years, with those that are best suited to their environment being the most successful and others that are less well suited not continuing to exist:
examples: Darwinists believe that students should learn more about evolution.
It does not take a Darwinist to work out that any competition has losers.
